incidents.name: Delayed runtime logs on bom1 and pdx1 regions

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Log delivery in all regions has returned to normal. We are continuing to monitor
pdx1 is no longer affected. We are still observing some delayed logs in bom1
We have confirmed that Log Drains were unaffected by this incident and continue to operate as normal.
We have identified a delay in log delivery specifically affecting bom1 and pdx1. We will continue to investigate and provide updates as this progresses.

incidents.name: Increase in INTERNAL_EDGE_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED errors

incident_updates.body: During a 4-minute window today between 12:47-12:51 UTC, we experienced a brief increase in 500 errors affecting a small subset of Edge Functions invocations. The issue was isolated to the following regions: lhr1, bom1, hkg1, cdg1, hdn1, iad1. Edge Middleware and Serverless Functions were unaffected.

incidents.name: Ignore Build Step triggered erroneously on some builds

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Deployments created after this time (13:44 UTC) should no longer face the issue.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Some builds are erroneously being cancelled with the message:

The Deployment has been cancelled as a result of running the command defined in the "Ignored Build Step" setting.

incidents.name: Blob Storage error rates

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating an increase in 400 errors related to Blob Storage.

incidents.name: Vercel Marketplace and Integrations Pages are Unavailable

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are currently investigating an issue where the Vercel Marketplace and Integrations pages are down. This affects the Integrations tab in the Vercel Dashboard and https://vercel.com/marketplace

Integration connections with your projects are not affected and it is only the dashboard that is unavailable. Integrations can also still be viewed from the Storage tab on the Vercel Dashboard.

incidents.name: Elevated request latency and errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incident_updates.body: We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - CDG1 - Paris, France, Europe

incident_updates.body: This issue occurred between 16:20 — 16:26 UTC and has already been resolved. We are monitoring our fixes to ensure the issue doesn't return.

incidents.name: Issue with DNS Record Propagation

incident_updates.body: The incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
We have pushed a fix and DNS record should be propagated now.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We are currently experiencing issue that prevent the creation of new DNS records for new domains. Thanks for your patience and understanding.

incidents.name: Elevated latency in services (Vercel dashboard, API, v0)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
The build queues are being processed and we're continuing to monitor the services.

Customers are currently experiencing elevated latency while accessing the Vercel dashboard, using the API or creating new prompts on v0. New builds are currently being queued and Log Drains are delayed.
The build queues are being processed and we're continuing to monitor the service.
Most services have recovered, and we're actively working on clearing the queued builds.
We have implemented a fix and are currently monitoring the service.
We are continuing to investigate. For urgent deployments, the Vercel CLI is unaffected and can be used. https://vercel.com/docs/cli
We're seeing recovery, but some services may still be partially degraded. We’re continuing to work on the mitigation.
We have identified the issue and working on a fix. Customer websites remain unaffected.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Customers are currently experiencing elevated latency while accessing the Vercel dashboard, using the API or creating new prompts on v0. New builds are currently being queued and Log Drains are delayed.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating elevated error rates for Vercel Functions or middleware traffic in the fra1, cpt1 and arn1 regions.

incidents.name: SSL certificate issues causing SSL/TLS errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified the root cause of this issue and are actively working on a fix.

We are currently investigating an issue with SSL certificates that may be causing SSL/TLS errors for visitors to sites hosted on Vercel.

We are actively working to resolve this matter and will provide further updates as soon as they become available.

incidents.name: Some Outlook / Microsoft Exchange users are not receiving Vercel login verification emails

incident_updates.body: The issue affecting the delivery of Vercel login verification emails to some Outlook / Microsoft Exchange users has been resolved. Our monitoring systems indicate that email deliverability has returned to normal levels. If you previously experienced delays, you may need to request a new login verification email.

We have observed that deliverability rates are now improving for customers, and will continue to monitor this issue. Customers may need to request a new login verification email if previous emails have not yet been received.

incidents.name: Traffic rerouted from Stockholm (arn1) to Frankfurt (fra1)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Normal traffic routing has been fully restored for the arn1 region (Stockholm).
We are beginning to restore normal traffic routing to the arn1 region (Stockholm).
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We’re currently investigating increased request latency in arn1 (Stockholm) region. End-users near this region may be experiencing degraded performance due to the increased latency, as we’re now rerouting traffic to another closest region.

incidents.name: Vercel Dashboard Observability delayed information

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The Observability dashboard is now displaying new data as expected while previously unavailable data is being populated.
The Observability feature within the Vercel dashboard is currently experiencing a delay of data since 22:15 UTC

incidents.name: Log Drains are delayed

incident_updates.body: The queue has been fully processed and this incident is now resolved.
We are continuing to process the queue.
We are continuing to process the queue.
We are continuing to process the queue.
A fix has been implemented and we are currently processing the queue. Log Drains should now begin flowing.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating an issue where Log Drains are delayed.

incidents.name: Customers are unable to log in or sign up via email

incident_updates.body: We experienced issues with email-based authentication from 11:15 to 12:40 UTC. During that time, users were not able to log in or sign up via email for both the Vercel platform and the v0 service. Logins or signups via GitHub, GitLab or Bitbucket were not impacted.

incidents.name: Vercel Functions and Edge Middleware errors in the sin1 region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are investigating a small percentage of Vercel Functions and Middleware invocations errors in our SIN1 region. Impacted customers may encounter 500 errors with the code INTERNAL_FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED.

incidents.name: Errors in the Vercel dashboard

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've implemented a fix for the dashboard issue and are monitoring the results.
We're currently investigating the errors that users are experiencing in the dashboard.

incidents.name: Elevated latencies for VDC and ISR in iad1

incident_updates.body: From 20:54:25 to 21:13:20 UTC, Functions executing in the `iad1` region observed elevated Vercel Data Cache timeouts, which may have led to increased function latency and timeouts. During the same window, ISR cache hits in `iad1` also experienced elevated latency.
There were elevated error rates in the iad1 region from 20:54 UTC to 21:13 UTC. The issue is now resolved.

affected_components.name: Edge Network - IAD1 - Washington DC, USA

incidents.name: Elevated error rates with Vercel Community authentication

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are investigating elevated authentication errors with Community

incidents.name: Error when updating team roles

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating an issue where users encounter a teamRoles property is not supported error when setting or updating team roles.

incidents.name: Error when purchasing domains via dashboard

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating an issue that is preventing users from purchasing domains via the Vercel dashboard and returning the error code bad_request.

incidents.name: Delay in Cron Job updates after deploying

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Cron Job updates are now taking effect immediately after deploying as expected. We are continuing to monitor.
Users may experience delays of 30 minutes or more for Cron Job updates to take effect after deploying.

incidents.name: Vercel Data Cache purge issue

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently experiencing an issue where the Vercel Data Cache is not respecting manual purge events. On-demand, tag-based, and time-based revalidations are working as expected.

incidents.name: Intermittent connectivity issues to Vercel-hosted sites in Spain due to ISP outage

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have observed restored connectivity in Spain and are actively monitoring for any further issues.

For end users in Spain, we are updating sites using Vercel nameservers, cname.vercel-dns.com and *.vercel.app, to new IP space to mitigate the ISP restrictions. And we have reached out to Telefonica for an update.
We are currently investigating intermittent connectivity to Vercel-hosted sites in Spain due to the Telefonica/Movistar ISP outage.

incidents.name: Cron jobs not updating for new deployments

incident_updates.body: Following a detailed investigation, we have confirmed that our Cron Jobs service and all other systems are operating as expected, and none of our customers are affected.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are currently investigating reports of changes to new cron jobs not being reflected when a deployment is created. Existing cron jobs are not affected. We will provide further updates as soon as they become available.

incidents.name: Unable to add domain to Preview Environments

incident_updates.body: We have released a fix and the issue has been resolved.
We are currently deploying a fix for this issue. The impact is limited to Preview Environments at this time.
We are currently investigating this issue as it is impacting Preview environments only at this time.

incidents.name: GitHub deployment and API errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
GitHub has mitigated the issue, and we are monitoring the results.

Due to a problem with GitHub, users may experience delayed deployments made with Vercel for GitHub and issues when using GitHub login. For more information, see the GitHub status: www.githubstatus.com/incidents/nm83zrdky73y

incidents.name: Issues displaying projects on Vercel Dashboard

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Intermittent error rates with Vercel Community, Learn and AI SDK authentication

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have identified the issue and a fix has been deployed.
We are investigating intermittent authentication errors with with Community, Learn and AI SDK

incidents.name: Serverless Functions deployed to incorrect region

incident_updates.body:
Between 16:04 and 18:33 (UTC) on January 21st, a small subset of deployments created Serverless Functions in the sfo1 (San Francisco, USA/us-west-1) region instead of their specified region. All functions remained fully operational during this period, with some users experiencing slightly elevated latency.
Vercel's systems have automatically relocated the affected functions to their correct regions. No action is required from customers.

incidents.name: Delayed Build processing

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We have identified a degraded internal API that is causing elevated build queue processing times for a small subset of customers, and are working on a fix. Existing deployments and live traffic remain unaffected. We will provide further updates if any changes occur.

We are currently investigating elevated build queue processing times for a small number of customers. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: In-Function Concurrency (Beta) update

incident_updates.body:
We have identified and resolved an issue impacting a subset of customers in the In-Function Concurrency Beta program. This issue only affects projects deployed between 2025-01-15 09:27 UTC and 14:33 UTC with In-Function Concurrency (Beta) enabled.

This issue solely impacts the cost-saving benefits of In-Function Concurrency.

The issue has been identified and resolved. To re-enable In-Function Concurrency savings, please redeploy your affected projects.

incidents.name: Issue with purchasing domain from Vercel Dashboard

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We're currently experiencing intermittent errors with our domain purchasing service. Some customers may have receive error purchasing domains at this time. Our team is fully aware of this issue and they're working diligently to resolve it as soon as possible.

incidents.name: Vercel Dashboard issue

incident_updates.body: The issue has been successfully resolved, and all Vercel dashboard functionalities have been fully restored.
A fix has been implemented and deployed for the impacted functionalities. We are monitoring the results.
Vercel Dashboard functionalities other than phone number verification are now fixed and being monitored. We are currently investigating the phone number verification issue.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We have identified an issue affecting a subset of Vercel Dashboard functionalities, such as phone number/email verification. We are currently investigating and will provide additional information as this progresses.

incidents.name: GitHub webhook outage resulting in intermittent build failures

incident_updates.body:
As a result of GitHub degradation, new Vercel deployments triggered from GitHub commits were delayed while the GitHub incident was active. Customers were still able to create deployments using the Vercel dashboard or the Vercel CLI.

Builds created between 2025-01-13 23:36 UTC and 2025-01-14 00:21 UTC may have been affected. Please refer to GitHub's status page for more information: https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/qd96yfgvmcf9

incidents.name: Elevated errors in domain settings

incident_updates.body: Our team identified an issue within the Domain settings interface that resulted in a "Failed to Load" error message. The issue was limited to the settings page and did not affect the functionality or performance of deployed websites, which remained fully operational. The root cause of the problem was identified and resolved.

incidents.name: Elevated error rates for Builds

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are currently seeing increased npm network errors that are causing elevated errors for some builds. Our team is continuing to monitor the situation. You can watch for npm updates on their status page, here: https://status.npmjs.org/incidents/jlqm624klvs2

incidents.name: Elevated cancelled deployments

incident_updates.body:
Due to a faulty build container update a small portion of builds failed to run correctly, causing builds to fail with the following message: "Error: It’s not possible to provide `stdio` in combination with one of `stdin`, `stdout`, `stderr`" or "Error: This deployment is no longer building, it was probably canceled and/or deleted"
Starting 17:58:47 UTC and ending 00:14 UTC

incidents.name: Data Cache Degraded For fra1

incident_updates.body: The data cache was degraded for fra1 from 08:13 to 08:34 UTC and from 09:48 to 09:50 UTC on 2024-12-24. During this period, requests to the Vercel Data Cache were slower and could cause Functions executions to time out.

incidents.name: Vercel Dashboard and API degradation

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are still investigating the issue affecting Vercel Dashboard and API access from bom1, iad1, cle1 fra1. This is not affecting existing customer deployments on Vercel.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified an issue affecting a subset of Vercel Dashboard features related to Teams. We are currently investigating and will provide additional information as this progresses.

incidents.name: ‘No Production Domain’ Message in Project Overview

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been implemented and new production domains will not have a problem. We’re currently working on applying the fix to existing domains. Please continue to follow our status page for updates on this issue.
We are skipping the domain assignment erroneously for deployments that are intended to be production.

incidents.name: Blob deliveries failing in some situations

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved, all blob URLs are working as usual.

The issue affecting the delivery of blobs with double slashes (//) in their URLs has been resolved. Blobs are now accessible as expected.

Please note that due to caching, some requests for these blobs may still be redirected for up to two hours. We are working to purge the cache to ensure immediate availability.

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

We are aware of an issue affecting the delivery of blobs that contain double slashes (//) in their URLs. These blobs may not be accessible at the moment due to an unexpected change in our URL handling.

Our team is actively working on a fix and will provide updates as soon as possible. We apologize for the inconvenience and appreciate your patience.

incidents.name: SSL Certificate Generation Delays

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating reports of delays in generating SSL certificates. We will provide a further update once available.

incidents.name: Elevated error rates on Vercel API

incident_updates.body: Elevated error rates for login and calls to Vercel API from 19:50 to 19:57 UTC

incidents.name: Edge Middleware/Functions Degradation in fra1 (Frankfurt, Germany)

incident_updates.body: On December 3rd from 13:49 - 14:46 UTC, we saw an increase in response time and 5xx errors from Edge Middleware/Functions in our fra1 (Frankfurt, Germany) region. This degradation has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Issue with .ai Domain Purchases & Transfer

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We're experiencing intermittent issues with the purchase of .ai domains on our platform. Our team is aware of the issue and are actively working to resolve this.

incidents.name: Delays Issuing New SSL Certificates

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the backlog of delayed certificates, which is decreasing.
Once the backlog of the affected domains is clear we will mark the incident as resolved
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating an issue causing new SSL certificates to be delayed.

incidents.name: Increased latency and error rate

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Increased latency and error rate for traffic served through Dublin, Ireland

incidents.name: Delayed information in Monitoring, and Firewall observability

incident_updates.body: From 21:17 to 21:46 UTC Monitoring and Firewall observability experienced a brief degradation, where the UI was unavailable. There was no data loss, and the issue has been mitigated.
